programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Dream Car

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at an innovative fire extinguisher that is saving lives around the world, and the care and attention that goes into making a Barbour waxed jacket

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of day two of the latest tournament of the season, which comes from Jack Nicklaus Golf Club in Incheon, South Korea

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Coronation Street star Claire Sweeney joins Katie to try hobby horse exercise. Celebrity hairdresser Michael Douglas and makeup artist Genevieve Turley transform founder of cancer support charity Help Harry Help Others, Georgie Moley. Chef Jonny Marsh prepares some treats for everyone

programme.title: A Year in the Beacons
programme.desc: Spring arrives at the Brecon Beacons National Park, and Flash and Stella Phillips are busy with lambing on the farm, while, as Covid hits, the isolated residents of the Beacons go into lockdown and Glanusk Estate owner Harry Legge-Bourke worries for the future of his business

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: Animated comedy musical featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Scarlett Johansson and Reese Witherspoon. Buster Moon, the koala owner of a failing theatre, decides to hold a talent show to save it. However, a printing error adds two zeroes to the $1,000 prize, resulting in a stampede of contestants - and a big headache for Buster.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Shivi Ramoutar makes fresh peamole on toast with smoked salmon and poached egg for this morning's guest Nicki Chapman and Jimmy Doherty joins in a celebration at the wildlife park for Arthur the camel's birthday. Local artist Lydia also shows how to block print

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Singer Matt Goss joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Jose Pizarro and Levi Roots provide the food and there are gardening tips from David Domoney

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Pastry chef Ravneet Gill joins Prue to make chocolate roulade and talk about her work with Counter Talk, an organisation dedicated to improving the treatment of staff in professional kitchens. Prue dishes up a savoury twist on the classic tarte tatin, and John is in his happy place working at a local dairy

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef goes behind the scenes of Dumfries House in Ayrshire, where he finds out about the structure and scale of the Queen Elizabeth walled garden. He also hears how King Charles's passion for sustainability is being passed on to a new generation

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the 2,000 Guineas from Newmarket, plus racing from Goodwood and Thirsk. Analysis comes from Jason Weaver, with reports by Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Karim Zeroual, Christopher Biggins, Ellie Leach and Des Clarke pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: There are 16 players left in the ITV's light-hearted answer to Squid Game. To avoid being eliminated, they must balance on a seesaw, lick lollipops until they are small enough to fit inside a bottle, compete in a race inside a sleeping bag and pack up a pop-up tent as fast as they can

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the second semi-final as more acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance of a place in the final. Judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, have the power to send one act straight through to the grand final with the golden buzzer, before the audience votes for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Writer Birdie is hoping for romance when she is matched with a wealthy farmer on a dating app. Despite a bad first date, she ignores her instincts and agrees to a second one. Before long, the chemistry escalates and she finds she is falling in love. Drama, starring Asher Keddie and David Wenham

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the final day of the regular season in the Football League, including Burnley v Millwall, Sheffield United v Blackburn Rovers and Plymouth Argyle v Leeds United in the Championship

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: LIV Golf Live

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: Detectives spend months piecing together the scale of Luke D'Wit's deception and cruelty after officers seize a huge stash of prescription drugs from his home, including those that were found in the Baxter's systems in the postmortem. Ellena Baxter comes to terms with the truth about her family friend

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The competition reaches its dramatic finale as Olivia drops one final shocking twist - and her biggest dilemma yet - and a winner is crowned.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: There are 16 players left in the ITV's light-hearted answer to Squid Game. To avoid being eliminated, they must balance on a seesaw, lick lollipops until they are small enough to fit inside a bottle, compete in a race inside a sleeping bag and pack up a pop-up tent as fast as they can

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the second semi-final as more acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance of a place in the final. Judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, have the power to send one act straight through to the grand final with the golden buzzer, before the audience votes for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Writer Birdie is hoping for romance when she is matched with a wealthy farmer on a dating app. Despite a bad first date, she ignores her instincts and agrees to a second one. Before long, the chemistry escalates and she finds she is falling in love. Drama, starring Asher Keddie and David Wenham

programme.title: The Assembly

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: When psychiatric registrar James Ford finds himself torn between a new mother attending a routine postnatal check-up and the sectioning of a psychotic woman during a busy on-call shift, no-one can predict the terrible consequences. The MIU are brought in to investigate, but digging deeper into the events that night leads to questions about Dr Ford and his hospital department. Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Singer Jade Thirlwall faces the grilling of a lifetime from an audience of autistic and learning-disabled interviewers. Does she regret selling her soul? Were the pyramids created by aliens? Does she get trapped wind? No question or line of enquiry is off the table. Expect revelation, chaos and a lot of laughs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Wine Tour: South Africa
programme.desc: The Take That star heads north with Jane McDonald as they touch down in Skukuza in the Kruger National Park. The singers enjoy a safari that includes a local breakfast favourite prepared by the resident head chef. Added to the mix is a local choir, high tea, South African sparkling wine and a magical experience with a family of elephants

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: New contestants Kai and Natasha take on the returning Jeopardy Champion, hoping to claim the crown for themselves. But winning on this show is never easy. Stephen Fry hosts

programme.title: Deal or No Deal Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Coronation Street star Simon Gregson tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, going head-to-head with the infamous Banker. Supported in the wings by his family, friends and a few famous faces, can Simon choose the right boxes and resist the Banker's tempting cash offers until just the right moment to take home a fortune for his chosen charity?

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Clemmie makes a discovery, Ross is devastated, and Moira tries to make Cain see sense

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Julie and Eileen go for a day out by the lake, Billy witnesses Theo in despair, Dee-Dee admits to forming a bond with Laila, and Rita orders Jenny to stop wallowing in self-pity and look to the future

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: Pressure mounts on Dr Ford as the investigation continues and when another traumatic incident occurs in the unit, he clashes with colleagues and the hospital's trust and leaves the future of the unit in doubt. Meanwhile, the MIU continue to dig into the events leading up to the incident and as they uncover discrepancies and questions, new evidence further undermines James' fitness to practice. Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: Detectives spend months piecing together the scale of Luke D'Wit's deception and cruelty after officers seize a huge stash of prescription drugs from his home, including those that were found in the Baxter's systems in the postmortem. Ellena Baxter comes to terms with the truth about her family friend

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The competition reaches its dramatic finale as Olivia drops one final shocking twist - and her biggest dilemma yet - and a winner is crowned.

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at an innovative fire extinguisher that is saving lives around the world, and the care and attention that goes into making a Barbour waxed jacket

programme.desc: Coronation Street star Claire Sweeney joins Katie to try hobby horse exercise. Chef Jonny Marsh prepares some treats for everyone

programme.title: A Year in the Beacons
programme.desc: Spring arrives at the Brecon Beacons National Park, and Flash and Stella Phillips are busy with lambing on the farm, while, as Covid hits, the isolated residents of the Beacons go into lockdown and Glanusk Estate owner Harry Legge-Bourke worries for the future of his business

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: Animated comedy musical featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Scarlett Johansson and Reese Witherspoon. Buster Moon, the koala owner of a failing theatre, decides to hold a talent show to save it. However, a printing error adds two zeroes to the $1,000 prize, resulting in a stampede of contestants - and a big headache for Buster.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
